pageContext.claim: “I looked at it and I watched him [Michael Bloomberg] pander at a church and practically beg for forgiveness [over his stop-and-frisk policy as mayor of New York]. I wouldn't have begged for forgiveness. I mean, he was doing his job at the time. And then he -- when he went up to the church, I thought it was disgraceful.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump takes every conceivable position on stop-and-frisk. He once called for a nationwide stop-and-frisk policy, then called Bloomberg "racist" for adopting it in New York, then said Bloomberg shouldn't have apologized for it.
